file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-50-18-06 - VOLCANIC ASH - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL VOLCANIC ASH - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do an inspection after the aircraft is submitted to a volcanic ash condition. B. A volcanic ash condition occurs when the aircraft: – Flight through a cloud of volcanic ash. – Makes a landing or takeoff in a volcanic ash fallout condition. – Does ground operations (towing, taxiing, parking) in a volcanic ash fallout condition. C. Volcanic ash is a highly abrasive material that can corrode the contaminated surfaces. NOTE: The texture of volcanic ash is almost the same as talcum powder. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 05-50-18-200-801-A VOLCANIC ASH CONDITION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 05-50-18 Page 1 of 36 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-50-18-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. VOLCANIC ASH CONDITION A. General (1) The inspection procedures described below must be done after the aircraft is submitted to a volcanic ash condition. (2) Indications of a volcanic ash condition: (a) A limited view through the windshields and windows. (b) An electrostatic discharge across the windshields. (c) A bright glow in the engine inlets along with subsequent engine shutdown. B. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 4 Mechanical technicians AR 2 Electrical technicians AR I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: DO NOT BREATH VOLCANIC ASH. DO NOT GET VOLCANIC ASH IN YOUR EYES. PUT ON PROTECTIVE CLOTHES, EYE GOGGLES, AND A RESPIRATOR MASK THAT IS SUFFICIENT TO FILTER VOLCANIC ASH PARTICLES. VOLCANIC ASH CAN CAUSE EYE IRRITATION AND INJURY TO THE RESPIRATORY SYSTEM. (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Make sure that landing gear safety pins are installed on the main and nose landing gears ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). (3) Make sure that the safety pin of the nose landing gear doors solenoid valve is installed (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (4) Clean and flush the aircraft external surfaces (AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-801-A/300), (AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-802-A/300), as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-50-18 Page 12 of 36 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: Be careful when you wash a contaminated aircraft with volcanic ash. Do not rub the surface too hard because volcanic ash is very abrasive. (5) Clean and flush the landing gear compartments (AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-803-A/ 300). (6) Clean the windshield. Flush it with a large volume of low-pressure water on the exterior surfaces. NOTE: This procedure will remove the contamination with no damage. (7) Clean the surface of the transparency in the usual manner. NOTE: Be careful because hard particles can still be on the transparency surface. J. Inspection SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) Structural inspection. (a) Externally examine the aircraft zones listed below for erosion, abrasion, painting bad condition, loosen bolts/rivets, nicks, skin deformation, sealant condition, warps, scratches, gouges, creases, cracks, dents, loose screws and deteriorated protective treatment: 1 Fuselage. 2 Rudder I and II. 3 Horizontal stabilizer. 4 Vertical stabilizer. 5 Horizontal to vertical stabilizer attachment. 6 Elevator. 7 Pylon. 8 Nacelle air inlet assembly. 9 Nacelle upper/lower cowlings. 10 Nacelle apron. 11 Nacelle reverser structure. 12 Nacelle plain exhaust. 13 Thrust reverser external zone. 14 Inboard, outboard and center wing leading edge. 15 Main door, baggage door, service door, and escape hatch. 16 Wing to fuselage fairings. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Examine the interior of the forward fuselage I (radome), for general condition (AMM TASK 05-20-02-200-801-A/600). (c) Examine the cockpit windshield for abrasion damage that limits vision ( AMM TASK 56-10-01-200-801-A/600), and the passenger cabin windows (TASK 56-20-00-200-801-A) for signs of damage. (d) Examine the windshield faceply and frames surfaces. Refer to Sierracin CMM 56-10-03 for scratch limits. (e) Examine the inboard and outboard flap ( AMM TASK 05-20-90-200-801-A/600), ( AMM TASK 05-20-92-200-801-A/600). (f) Examine the aileron ( AMM TASK 05-20-94-200-801-A/600). (g) Examine the wing root ( AMM TASK 05-20-82-200-801-A/600), ( AMM TASK 05-20-84-200-801-A/600). (h) Examine the wing middle section, between spar I and spar II ( AMM TASK 05-20-86-200-801-A/600). (i) Examine the wing tip section, between spar I and spar II ( AMM TASK 05-20-88-200-802-A/600). (j) Examine the ground spoiler (AMM TASK 05-30-28-200-801-A/600). (k) Examine the speed brake (AMM TASK 05-30-30-200-801-A/600). (l) Examine the airframe drainage (AMM TASK 12-23-00-600-801-A/300). (m) Examine the main door seal, service door seal and cargo door seal. (n) Examine the scotch brand abrasion resistant film applied on aircraft zones listed below: 1 NACA air intake wing to fuselage fairing. 2 NACA air intake forward fuselage I. 3 Radome. 4 Pylon Leading edge. 5 Horizontal stabilizer tip. 6 horizontal stabilizer leading edge root fairings. 7 VOR antenna. 8 Vertical stabilizer leading edge. 9 Front fixed fairing. 10 Wing tip. (o) If you find damage to the aircraft structure, repair the affected parts. Refer to the structural repair manual. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: If necessary, consult Embraer Engineering. (2) External light inspection. (a) Examine the external lights that follow for abrasions and damage. NOTE: Replace the lights that are frosted or damaged. 1 Landing Light Lamp ( AMM TASK 33-41-02-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 33-41-02-400-801-A/400). 2 Nose landing gear taxi Light Lamp ( AMM TASK 33-42-02-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 33-42-02-400-801-A/400). 3 Main/standby wing navigation lights ( AMM TASK 33-43-03-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 33-43-03-400-801-A/400). 4 Main/standby rear navigation lights ( AMM TASK 33-43-05-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 33-43-05-400-801-A/400). 5 Inspection lights ( AMM TASK 33-44-02-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 33-44-02-400-801-A/400). 6 Strobe lights ( AMM TASK 33-47-03-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 33-47-03-400-801-A/400). 7 Red beacon lights ( AMM TASK 33-47-05-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 33-47-05-400-801-A/400). 8 Red beacon lights lens ( AMM TASK 33-47-05-000-802-A/400), ( AMM TASK 33-47-05-400-802-A/400). (3) External sensors inspection. (a) Visually examine the pitot 1 and 2 sensors, pitot/static 3 sensor, total air temperature (TAT) 1 and 2 sensors, anemometric static ports 1, 2, 3 and 4 for signs of volcanic ash. NOTE: Examine each sensor mentioned above for abrasions and damage. (b) Replace the damaged sensors. NOTE: Send the old pitots sensors and TAT sensors to the vendor (Rosemount Aerospace) to be evaluated. 1 To replace the pitot 1 and 2 sensors refer to ( AMM TASK 34-13-01-000-801-A/400), and ( AMM TASK 34-13-01-400-801-A/400). 2 To replace the pitot/static 3 sensor refer to (AMM TASK 34-13-02-000-801- A/400), and (AMM TASK 34-13-02-400-801-A/400). 3 To replace the TAT 1 and 2 sensors refer to (AMM TASK 34-15-03-000-801-A/400), and (AMM TASK 34-15-03-400-801-A/400). 4 To replace the anemometric static ports 1, 2, 3 and 4 refer to (AMM TASK 34-13-03-000-801-A/400), and ( AMM TASK 34-13-03-400-801-A/400). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) Clean the pitot and static lines ( AMM TASK 34-13-00-600-801-A/200). (d) Replace the ice detector (AMM TASK 30-80-01-000-801-A/400). NOTE: Send the old ice detector to the vendor (Rosemount Aerospace). (e) Do the ice detection system operational test ( AMM TASK 30-80-00-700-801-A/ 500). (f) Do the functional check of the ADC system ( AMM TASK 34-15-00-700-801-A/ 500). (4) Forward electric/electronic compartment inspection. (a) Visually examine the equipments installed in the electronic compartment for signs of volcanic ash. 1 Examine the AHRS unit for signs of volcanic ash. If necessary, replace the AHRS unit (AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/400), and ( AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400). NOTE: Return it to manufacturer Service Center for evaluation. 2 Examine and clean the AHRS fan filter (AMM TASK 34-21-03-100-801-A/ 700). If necessary, replace the filter. 3 Do the operational check of the AHRS (AMM TASK 34-21-00-700-802-A/ 500). 4 Examine the integrated navigation unit (RNZ) for signs of volcanic ash. If necessary, replace it ( AMM TASK 34-32-01-000-801-A/400), and ( AMM TASK 34-32-01-400-801-A/400). NOTE: Return it to manufacturer Service Center for evaluation. 5 Examine and clean the integrated navigation unit fan filter. If necessary, replace the filter. 6 Do the operational test of the VOR/ILS system ( AMM TASK 34-32-00-700-801-A/500). 7 Examine the Air Data Computer (ADC) for signs of volcanic ash. If necessary, replace the ADC ( AMM TASK 34-15-01-000-801-A/400), and ( AMM TASK 34-15-01-400-801-A/400). NOTE: Return it to manufacturer Service Center for evaluation. 8 Do the operational test of the ADC System (AMM TASK 34-15-00-700-802- A/500). 9 Examine the FMS computer for signs of volcanic ash. If necessary, replace the FMS computer ( AMM TASK 34-61-01-000-801-A/400), and ( AMM TASK 34-61-01-400-801-A/400). NOTE: Return it to manufacturer Service Center for evaluation. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 10 Do the operational test of the Flight Management System ( AMM TASK 34-61-00-700-801-A/500). (b) Examine the Integrated Communication Unit (RCZ) for signs of volcanic ash. If necessary, replace it ( AMM TASK 23-00-01-000-801-A/400), and ( AMM TASK 23-00-01-400-801-A/400). NOTE: Return the affected unit to the service center for evaluation. (c) Do the functional test of the VHF system ( AMM TASK 23-12-00-700-805-A/500). (d) Backup battery and dimmers. 1 Remove the dimmers ( AMM TASK 33-12-01-000-801-A/400). 2 Clean the dimmers (Avtech CMM 33-10-02 P/N 1826-1). 3 Install the dimmers ( AMM TASK 33-12-01-400-801-A/400). 4 Do a backup battery restore ( AMM TASK 24-35-01-900-801-A/200). 5 Remove the backup battery relay box ( AMM TASK 24-35-02-000-801-A/ 400). 6 Examine the box for dust collection and signs of volcanic ash contamination. NOTE: If ash appears to have entered the box, replace it. 7 Install the backup battery relay box ( AMM TASK 24-35-02-400-801-A/400). (e) Main batteries. 1 Do a main battery restore ( AMM TASK 24-36-01-900-802-A/200). 2 Remove the main battery 1 relay box ( AMM TASK 24-36-02-000-801-A/ 400). 3 Remove the main battery 2 relay box ( AMM TASK 24-36-03-000-801-A/ 400). 4 Examine the boxes for dust collection and signs of volcanic ash contamination. NOTE: If ash appears to have entered the box, replace it. 5 Install the main battery 1 relay box ( AMM TASK 24-36-02-400-801-A/400). 6 Install the main battery 2 relay box ( AMM TASK 24-36-03-400-801-A/400). (5) APU starter/generator inspection. (a) Remove the APU starter generator ( AMM TASK 24-34-01-000-801-A/400). (b) Check and clean the APU starter generator (Lucas Aerospace CMM with IPL DC Starter-Generator, 23080 series III). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: If necessary, repair or replace it. Obey the CMM procedures. (c) Install the APU starter generator ( AMM TASK 24-34-01-400-801-A/400). (6) Main Generator inspection. (a) Remove the main generator (AMM TASK 24-31-01-000-801-A/400). (b) Check and clean the main generator (Lucas Aerospace CMM with IPL DC Generator, 30086 series II). NOTE: If necessary, repair or replace it. Obey the CMM procedures. (c) Install the main generator (AMM TASK 24-31-01-400-801-A/400). (7) Nose landing gear inspection. (a) Visually examine the nose landing compartment for signs of volcanic ash. 1 Examine the up lock box. NOTE: • Replace it ( AMM TASK 32-33-07-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 32-33-07-400-801-A/400), if volcanic ash were found in the up lock box aperture. • Send it to a repair shop for internal inspection. 2 Examine the pulley and cables of the free-fall mechanism. Do the free-fall control cables check ( AMM TASK 32-34-03-700-801-A/500). 3 Examine the emergency/parking brake cable and valve. Do the functional check of the emergency/parking brake system ( AMM TASK 32-44-00-700-801-A/500). 4 Examine the left and right ball bearings of the nose landing gear leg articulation. 5 Examine the left and right ball bearings of the upper main brace strut articulation. 6 Examine the ball bearings of the lower main brace strut. 7 Examine the piston rods of the unlocking and maneuvering actuators. 8 Examine the torque link bushings. 9 Examine the sliding tube. 10 Examine the nose landing gear doors ( AMM TASK 32-20-05-200-801-A/ 600) and the hydraulic actuator piston rods of nose landing gear doors. (b) If you find signs of volcanic ash, remove the ash. (c) If you find a damaged component, repair or replace the component. (d) Lubricate the nose landing gear ( AMM TASK 32-34-00-600-801-A/300). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: All joints, connections, and bearing surfaces must be in a clean condition. (8) Main landing gear inspection. (a) Visually examine the main landing compartment for signs of volcanic ash. 1 Examine the up lock box. NOTE: • Replace it ( AMM TASK 32-33-07-000-801-A/400), ( AMM TASK 32-33-07-400-801-A/400), if volcanic ash were found in the up lock box aperture. • Send it to a repair shop for internal inspection. 2 Examine the pulley and cables of the free-fall mechanism. Do the free-fall control cables check ( AMM TASK 32-34-03-700-801-A/500). 3 Examine the fore and aft ball bearings of the main landing gear articulation. 4 Examine the fore and aft ball bearings of the upper main landing gear articulation. 5 Examine the ball bearings of the lower main brace strut. 6 Examine the piston rods of the unlocking and maneuvering actuators. 7 Examine the shock absorber ( AMM TASK 32-10-02-200-801-A/600). 8 Examine the area between brake pistons and plate ( AMM TASK 32-49-03-200-801-A/600). 9 Examine the main landing gear doors ( AMM TASK 32-10-00-200-801-A/ 600). (b) If you find signs of volcanic ash, remove the ash. (c) If you find a damaged component, repair or replace the component. (d) Lubricate the main landing gear ( AMM TASK 32-34-00-600-801-A/300). NOTE: All joints, connections, and bearing surfaces must be in a clean condition. (9) Fuel system inspection. WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE FUEL SYSTEM INSPECTION, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (a) Drain the fuel tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-03-600-801-A/300). Visually examine the collected fuel for volcanic ash contamination. (b) Defuel the fuel tanks by gravity method ( AMM TASK 12-11-02-600-802-A/300). (c) Examine the NACA air inlets for signs of volcanic ash contamination and for absence of obstruction (AMM TASK 28-12-03-200-801-A/600). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-50-18 Page 19 of 36 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: Clean the NACA air inlets if signs of volcanic ash were found. (d) Examine the flame arrestor for signs of volcanic ash contamination and for absence of obstruction (AMM TASK 28-12-05-200-801-A/600). (e) Examine the vent valves screens for signs of volcanic ash contamination and for absence of obstruction. (f) Examine the vent float valves and vent valves for signs of volcanic ash contamination and for absence of obstruction (AMM TASK 28-12-01-700-801-A/ 500). (g) Remove the fuel line drain plug (located near the fuel tank drain valve), to drain the fuel lines. NOTE: After draining the fuel lines do not forget to install the fuel line drain plug. (h) Do a visual inspection of the ejector pump for integrity and make sure that the screen and nozzle are not clogged ( AMM TASK 28-21-02-200-801-A/600). (i) Examine the APU fuel inlet filter and the APU fuel pump filter. Refer to Hamilton Sundstrand Engine Manual 40C11-1, P/N 4501966 or Hamilton Sundstrand Engine Manual 40C14-1, P/N 4504112. (j) Remove the tank units ( AMM TASK 28-41-02-000-801-A/400). Examine the probes for volcanic ash contamination and clean them if necessary. (k) Do the decontamination of integral fuel tanks for volcanic ash ( AMM TASK 28-11-00-300-802-A/700). NOTE: Is not necessary to do the methyl alcohol application procedure. (10) Engines inspection. (a) Examine the engines after operation in a volcanic ash fallout condition. Refer to the latest revision of Rolls-Royce MM TASK 05-50-00-200-803. (b) Do the applicable test of the engines according to the latest revision of Rolls- Royce MM CSP 34022, TASK 72-00-00-700-801. (11) Auxiliary power unit (APU) inspection. (a) Remove the air inlet screens. (b) Visually examine the compressor leading edges for evidence of significant removal of material from the root of the leading edges (1/8th inch concavity or more). NOTE: Remove the APU ( AMM MPP 49-10-01/400) if evidence were found. A detail inspection must be done. Refer to Sundstrand Engine Manual 49-00-00. (c) The Pcd tubes, check valve and combustor drain must be removed (AMM MPP 49-31-02/400, AMM MPP 49-17-01/400) and flushed/washed with water and detergent or solvent to remove any particulates. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-50-18 Page 20 of 36 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (d) If high concentrations of sulfur are suspected to be present in the atmosphere or the ash, a water wash is advised (Sundstrand Engine Manual 49-00-00). (e) If the performance has deteriorated beyond specific limits (AMM MPP 49-02-00/200, AMM MPP 49-00-00/200), remove the APU ( AMM MPP 49-10-01/400) and do a borescope or physical inspection of the APU with the combustor removed. Refer to Sundstrand Engine Manual 49-00-00. (12) Flight controls inspection. (a) Examine the actuator bare piston rods of the components that follow for signs of volcanic ash contamination: 1 Aileron PCA's ( AMM TASK 27-12-01-200-802-A/600). 2 Aileron dampers (AMM TASK 27-12-03-200-801-A/600), if applicable. 3 Rudder actuators (AMM TASK 27-22-02-200-801-A/600). 4 Rudder stop actuators. 5 Spoilers (AMM TASK 27-62-00-200-801-A/600). (b) Examine all control cables for signs of volcanic ash contamination ( AMM TASK 27-11-00-200-801-A/600), ( AMM TASK 27-21-01-200-802-A/600), ( AMM TASK 27-31-01-200-803-A/600). (c) Examine the horizontal stabilizer actuator for signs of volcanic ash contamination (AMM TASK 27-40-02-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The OPEN indication on the engine anti-icing panel will come on. 15 Keep this condition for 5 minutes. NOTE: Obey the engine temperature level limits for ground operations. 16 Stop the engines ( AMM TASK 71-00-01-910-804-A/200). 17 Do the engine thermal anti-icing functional test ( AMM TASK 30-21-00-700-802-A/500). 18 Do the engine thermal anti-icing operational test ( AMM TASK 30-21-00-700-803-A/500). (d) Windshield wiper system. 1 Remove the arm/blade assembly ( AMM TASK 30-41-03-000-801-A/400). 2 Clean with a dry clean cloth the bearing of the motor/converter; remove all the volcanic ash accumulated. 3 Clean with a dry clean cloth the arm/blade assembly. 4 After cleaning, examine the arm/blade assembly for damage. NOTE: If it is damaged, replace arm/blade assembly ( AMM TASK 30-41-03-000-801-A/400). 5 If it is not damaged, install the arm/blade assembly ( AMM TASK 30-41-03-400-801-A/400). 6 Adjust the arm/blade assembly (TASK 30-41-03-800-801-A). 7 Clean with a dry clean cloth the windshield wiper control box. 8 Do the windshield wiper system operational test ( AMM TASK 30-41-00-700-801-A/500). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (e) Windshield heating system. 1 If there is a big concentration of volcanic ash, clean with a dry clean cloth the windshield power contactor box. (f) Do the anti-icing system operational test ( AMM TASK 30-00-00-700-802-A/500). (g) Do the anti-icing system operational check ( AMM TASK 30-00-00-700-801-A/ 500). (21) Interior inspection. (a) Examine the internal areas of the aircraft for signs of volcanic ash contamination. 1 Visually examine the cockpit and its components listed below: a Flight instruments. b Electrical/electronic control panels. c Pilot and Copilot seats. d Observer seat. e Head-up display. f Hatch. g Consoles. h Floor cover. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 2 Visually examine the passenger compartment and its components listed below: a Wardrobes. b Passengers seats. c Attendant seats. d Galley and its components. e Lavatory and its components. f Overhead bin. g Life vest. h Placards and lights. i Floor cover. j Headline, windscreens, and sidewall lining panels. k Doors. l Closets. 3 Visually examine the baggage compartment for signs of volcanic ash contamination. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the pressurization control system functional test in automatic mode (AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-802-A/500), and the functional test of outflow valves (AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-804-A/500). (2) Do the operational test in manual mode of the pressurization control system (AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-801-A/500). (3) Do the test of the overpressurization relief devices with a pressurization test bench (AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-807-A/500). (4) Do the functional test of the cabin pressure acquisition module ( AMM TASK 21-32-01-700-801-A/500). (5) Do the operational check of the ram air valve ( AMM TASK 21-25-01-700-801-A/500). (6) Do the operational test of the cooling pack system (AMM TASK 21-51-00-700-802-A/ 500). (7) Do the operational test of the temperature control system ( AMM TASK 21-60-00-700-801-A/500). (8) Do the functional test of the cooling pack system (AMM TASK 21-51-00-700-803-A/ 500), or (AMM TASK 21-51-00-700-805-A/500), as applicable. (10) Do the operational test of the conditioned air distribution system ( AMM TASK 21-20-00-700-801-A/500). (11) Supply clean bleed air through the APU for 5 minutes ( AMM TASK 36-00-00-860-802- A/200), to clean the pressure regulator valves, check valves and vacuum pump. (12) Install the panels or others items possibly removed for the inspection above. (13) Put the aircraft back to its initial condition.
